result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:18 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Bradley Dean Blanchard in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Bradley Dean Blanchard.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF26, 22CF92, 22CF316- PH needed. Court reviews file.  Atty Firkus states an offer has been made but no agreement, asking to set PH. DE verified address and updates phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:20 AM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
NOH (STC) returned by PO. Return to sender. Vacant. Unable to forward. Filed in 22CF316, 22CF92, 22CF26. olg

AMENDED

Includes 22CF26, 22CF316, & 22CF92

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness or with the residence of T.J.W. (548 Nordic Lane Apt 4, Hudson WI 54016). The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to call Justice Support Center at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.  I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:41 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Bradley Dean Blanchard in court, in custody.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Bradley Dean Blanchard.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF26 & 22CF92.  Court reviews file and notes DE has a file in Branch IV- 22CF316.  Attorneys make statements.  ADA Smestad asking to have a PH done before bond is amended on 22CF316.  Atty Firkus states DE would like to waive prelim on 22CF316.  Court calls 22CF316, Atty Firkus is not appointed to this case so advice is limited but has had DE in the past and understands what waving prelim is about. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court administratively transfers 22CF316 to Branch III. Adjourned at 10:00 AM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bradley Dean Blanchard in court, in custody. INCLUDES 22CF316 (RWIN), 22CF92 (RW) and 22CF26 (RW). Intern Krause gives reasoning for DE's missed appearance. 22CF316: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  DE has active warrant from Pierce County. Court notes missed testing. Court sets bond in 22CF316, reinstates on 22CF92 and 22CF26. DE qualifies for public defender, Atty. Firkus is on other cases. QUASH WARRANTS. Adjourned: 1:14 PM. kma
